intro: Euphorbia semperflorens, commonly known as the赪根草 or winter coral, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
